⊢ Fin3 = { hs0 | ∀(hs1 ∈(P(hs0)[↦]_om),(∀(hs2 ∈ _om,(hs1 ` suc(hs2))⊆(hs1 ` hs2))→ ⋂ ran(hs1)∈ ran(hs1)))}
⊣ d(hs0, hs1)
⊣ d(hs0, hs2)
⊣ d(hs1, hs2)

comment: Weakly Dedekind-infinite sets are exactly those with an ` _om ` -indexed descending chain of subsets. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 7-Nov-2014.)
